He invaded Turkestan, Kipzak, Ruffia, Hindostan, Syria, Anatolia‚ Armenia, and Georgia, without a hope or a defire of preserving those distant provinces. The kingdoms of Transoxiana and Perfia were the proper field which he laboured to cultivate and adorn, as the perpetual inheritance of his family. But his peaceful labours were often interrupted‚ and sometimes blasted, by the absence of the conqueror. While he triumphed on the Volga or the Gange5‚ his servants, and even his sons, forgot their master and their duty.
